column4: The actual problem is not IP address related. The issue is that after changing my mac address in linux I suddenly become unable to establish a connection or session with my wireless access point.
The router is owned by me
I cannot even connect to the router and get an IP address
I bring the wifi device down using ifconfig, change the mac, then bring the device back up using ifconfig
then try to connect, no luck
is there some logs somewhere that show me how far in the connection i was able to get?
i want to connect to the wireless router after i have changed my mac
currently i cannot connect to the router.
the router is owned by me
you asked me to do that before, i spent 15 mins afterwards re inputting the config
is there a device that shares the mac of the one you are changing your card to?
is there a device that shares the mac of the one you are changing your card to?
is that machine turned off?
what if you try a mac that is not your work laptops, can you connect then?
as in a completely made up mac
well?
looks like its a problem with the state your card is in after changing the mac...
what chipset?
i dont know if it resets the mac, but you could try sudo service networking restart as well
Can i send you a private message with the data that i collected from that attempt, it is a bit big to spam the channel with
my pm is all yours...
